Class Room

java.lang.Object
com.university.dungeon.room.Room
public class Room extends Object
Represents a room in the dungeon. Each room can contain items, traps, chests, and information about adjacent rooms in different directions.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Room

      public Room(String label, boolean isEntrance, boolean isExit, boolean isTreasureRoom, boolean isWall, ITrap trap, IChest chest)
      Constructor for creating a new Room instance.
      Parameters:
      label - The name/label of the room.
      isEntrance - Whether the room is the dungeon's entrance.
      isExit - Whether the room is the dungeon's exit.
      isTreasureRoom - Whether the room contains treasure.
      isWall - Whether the room is a wall.
      trap - An optional trap that may be in the room.
      chest - An optional chest that may be in the room.

  • Method Details

    • getRoomInDirection

      public Room getRoomInDirection(Direction direction)
      Retrieves the room in a specified direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction to check for an adjacent room.
      Returns:
      The room in the specified direction, or null if there is no adjacent room.

    • setAdjacentRooms

      public void setAdjacentRooms(HashMap<Direction,Room> adjacentRooms)
      Sets the adjacent rooms for this room.
      Parameters:
      adjacentRooms - A HashMap of adjacent rooms with their directions.

    • getItems

      public List<IItem> getItems()
      Returns the list of items present in this room.
      Returns:
      A List of IItem objects representing the items in the room.

    • getItemByName

      public IItem getItemByName(String itemName)
      Retrieves an item by its name.
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the item to search for.
      Returns:
      The IItem object if found, otherwise null.

    • removeItem

      public boolean removeItem(IItem item)
      Removes an item from the room.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to remove from the room.
      Returns:
      True if the item was successfully removed, otherwise false.

    • addItem

      public void addItem(IItem item)
      Adds an item to the room.
      Parameters:
      item - The IItem object to add to the room.

    • getAdjacentRooms

      public HashMap<Direction,Room> getAdjacentRooms()
      Returns a map of adjacent rooms and their directions.
      Returns:
      A HashMap where the key is the direction and the value is the room in that direction.

    • isEntrance

      public boolean isEntrance()
      Checks if the room is the dungeon entrance.
      Returns:
      True if the room is the entrance, otherwise false.

    • isExit

      public boolean isExit()
      Checks if the room is the dungeon exit.
      Returns:
      True if the room is the exit, otherwise false.

    • isTreasureRoom

      public boolean isTreasureRoom()
      Checks if the room contains treasure.
      Returns:
      True if the room is a treasure room, otherwise false.

    • isVisited

      public boolean isVisited()
      Checks if the room has been visited by the player.
      Returns:
      True if the room has been visited, otherwise false.

    • setVisited

      public void setVisited(boolean visited)
      Sets the room's visited status.
      Parameters:
      visited - True if the room has been visited, otherwise false.

    • isWall

      public boolean isWall()
      Checks if the room is a wall.
      Returns:
      True if the room is a wall, otherwise false.

    • getLabel

      public String getLabel()
      Returns the label (name) of the room.
      Returns:
      A string representing the room's label.

    • getTrap

      public ITrap getTrap()
      Retrieves the trap present in the room, if any.
      Returns:
      The ITrap object if there is a trap, otherwise null.

    • getChest

      public IChest getChest()
      Retrieves the chest present in the room, if any.
      Returns:
      The IChest object if there is a chest, otherwise null.

    • describe

      public void describe()
      Provides a description of the room, including its items and whether there is a chest.
